solution_line_template: In a day, Megan earns {hours_per_day} x ${wage_per_hour} = $<<{hours_per_day}*{wage_per_hour}={daily_earnings}>>{daily_earnings}.
In a month, she will be earning {days_per_month} x ${daily_earnings} = $<<{days_per_month}*{daily_earnings}={monthly_earnings}>>{monthly_earnings}.
Therefore, Megan will earn a total of {num_months} x ${monthly_earnings} = $<<{num_months}*{monthly_earnings}={total_earnings}>>{total_earnings} for two months of work.
